title: Chuck Grassley Suddenly Concerned About People Lying to Congress
content:
Republican Senate Judiciary Chairman Chuck Grassley has requested that Attorney General Jeff Sessions and FBI Director Chris Wray open an investigation into attorney Michael Avenatti and his client Julie Swetnick , alleging the pair may have made “ materially false statements ” to Congress as part of the confirmation process for now-Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh .
“ While many of those individuals [ involved in the Kavanaugh hearing and subsequent investigation ] have provided the Committee information in good faith , it unfortunately appears some have not , ” Grassley wrote In a Thursday letter to the Department of Justice and FBI written on Thursday .
Grassley then goes on to describe in granular detail a number of alleged “ contradictions ” in Swetnick ’ s claim that she witnessed Kavanaugh attempting to drug young women for the purpose of raping them at house parties in the early 1980s . Swetnick has also stated that Kavanaugh was present when she herself was gang raped at one such party .
Grassley also extensively cites a number of unrelated issues with both Avenatti and Swetnick ’ s “ credibility ” —such as Avenatti ’ s allegedly problematic financial dealings and Swetnick ’ s alleged behavior with a past boyfriend—as further proof that the pair should be investigated by the Justice Department .
“ When charlatans make false claims to the Committee – claims that may earn them short-term media exposure and financial gain , but which hinder the Committee ’ s ability to do its job – there should be consequences , ” Grassley wrote . “ These laws exist to ensure there are . ”
Grassley ’ s extensive attack on both Swetnick and Avenatti stands in sharp contrast to the largely defanged investigation into Kavanaugh himself , which conspicuously downplayed and even ignored numerous credible allegations of both sexual misconduct and perjury .
In response to Grassley ’ s letter , Avenatti issued a taunting statement that welcomed the investigation , saying :
It is ironic that Sen. Grassley now is interested in investigations . He didn ’ t care when it came to putting a man on the SCOTUS for life . We welcome the investigation as now we can finally get to the bottom of Judge Kavanaugh ’ s lies and conduct . Let the truth be known .
You can read the full Grassley letter here . The Justice Department has not yet responded to Grassley ’ s request .
